intro: Fagara pohliana, commonly known as the Pohliana wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Guatemala and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that have a distinctive grayish-white color. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. Fagara pohliana is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
